title: Groom-to-be 'sexually assaulted bridesmaid two days before wedding' and fiancee still married him
text:
A groom-to-be sexually assaulted a 'drunk' bridesmaid two days before his wedding, and the bride-to-be still married him despite witnessing the incident at a Pennsylvania venue.

Daniel Carney, 28, of Stroudsburg, has been charged with involuntary deviate sexual intercourse of an unconscious person and indecent assault.

The victim, a 29-year-old Oregon woman, said she was sexually assaulted at the Shawnee Inn in Smithfield Township on August 30.

Daniel Carney (pictured), 28, of Stroudsburg, has been charged with involuntary deviate sexual intercourse of an unconscious person and indecent assault

The victim, a 29-year-old Oregon woman, said she was sexually assaulted at the Shawnee Inn in Smithfield Township on August 30, two days before Carney was to marry his fiancee (pictured together)

She told police that she was in town to attend Carney's September 1 wedding and said the assault occurred in a downstairs men's locker room.

According to WNEP, the wedding party spent the day drinking alcohol.

The victim became very drunk and even blacked out at some point during the day.

When she woke up, she told authorities that she found herself in the men's locker room with Carney fondling her and her bikini bottom removed.

A short time later, Carney's bride-to-be walked in the room and witnessed the incident.

That led to a fight between the bride-to-be and Carney.

After the incident, police said Carney admitted to taking advantage of the woman and leading her into the locker room. Despite it all, Carney and the bride-to-be got married on September 1 at the Shawnee Inn (pictured)

Investigators corroborated the victim's story by reviewing surveillance footage that shows Carney pulling the victim into the locker room.

Police said the woman appeared to be 'extremely unsteady'.

After the incident, police said Carney admitted to taking advantage of the woman and leading her into the locker room.

Despite it all, Carney and the bride-to-be got married on September 1.

It's unclear if the victim remained a bridesmaid in the wedding.
description: Groom-to-be. Daniel Carney, of Pennsylvania, sexually assaulted a 'drunk' bridesmaid two days before his wedding, and the bride-to-be still married him despite witnessing the incident.
